On Jun 9, 2009, at 6:23 PM, Stefan Tilkov wrote:
> Apologies for picking just one fragment from your reply, but It  
> seems to me that the question is whether the way this
>
> On 09.06.2009, at 17:11, Roy T. Fielding wrote:
>
>> a TM-style
>> manager resource that tells all of the other services to commit
>> the associated changes to a more persistent or public set of
>> resources
>
> is done is worth being standardized.

Maybe, but it is behind the resource interface.  It is some other
architecture which can (and should) be allowed to change over time
without impacting the RESTful part of the system.  [It might even be
another RESTful architecture behind the interface -- the point is
we don't know and cannot make any client assumptions based on it.]

....Roy
